title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:02 <vmassol> has quit  
00:39 <mflorea1> has quit  
02:26 <sdumitriu> has quit  
03:15 <npm> has quit  
03:17 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
03:29 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
03:29 <jvdrean> has quit  
03:30 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
03:33 <jvdrean> has quit  
03:49 <abusenius> has quit  
06:19 <DrLou> has quit  
07:03 <Denis> has quit  
07:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:46 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
07:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <vmassol> good morning  
08:15 <+mflorea> vmassol: good morning. do you know if I can run java 6 in java 5 mode? The reason is that I want to detect which jars have been build with java 6, to rebuild them with java 5. I searched a bit and I couldn't find anything about this so I guess the only option is to install a 1.5 jre right?  
08:16 <vmassol> mflorea: hi. Yes I think so  
08:16 <+mflorea> ok, thanks  
08:16 <vmassol> what you can do  
08:16 <vmassol> (I think)  
08:17 <vmassol> is tell the java 6 compiler to only use java5 elements  
08:17 <vmassol> but it'll still be compiled with java6  
08:18 <+mflorea> sure, but that is at compile time. I'm looking for a way to detect this at run time, i.e. detect which jars have been build with java 5  
08:18 <vmassol> you can check the java id  
08:18 <vmassol> java compiler id  
08:18 <+mflorea> is it in the jar?  
08:18 <vmassol> but you might have to read the jar as a zip file  
08:19 <vmassol> I mean read the file  
08:21 <+mflorea> hmm, I see there is "Build-Jdk" property in MANIFEST.MF, I suppose most of the jars will have it.  
08:27 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <+mflorea> I suppose Build-Jdk: 1.6.0\_18 and X-Compile-Target-JDK: 1.5 means the jar was build with 1.6 but is compatible with 1.5  
08:43 <j-saturne> has quit  
08:55 <vmassol> mflorea: there's still one wysiwyg flickering test: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/746/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/TabsTest/testSwitchToSourceWithoutHTMLChanges/  
08:55 <+mflorea> yep, I'll handle it asap  
08:56 <vmassol> hmm this is strange: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/84/testReport/  
08:56 <+mflorea> isn't it because the browser didn't start?  
08:56 <vmassol> I'm looing at console: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/84/console  
08:57 <vmassol> it says: Tests run: 831, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 82  
08:57 <vmassol> not sure why tests would be skipped though  
08:58 <vmassol> there's no browser startezd mflorea  
08:58 <vmassol> (for the escaping tests)  
08:58 <+mflorea> ok  
09:00 <vmassol> but there' sa browser issue for sure http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/84/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/AllTests/org\_xwiki\_test\_ui\_AllTests/  
09:00 <vmassol> well  
09:00 <vmassol> the dislpay seems down again  
09:01 <+sburjan> when the new CI machine will be installed ?  
09:01 <vmassol> when it's ready  
09:01 <vmassol> :)  
09:01 <vmassol> let's say soon  
09:01 <vmassol> I was told yesterday but as you can see it's not there  
09:02 <vmassol> so soon is the best I know  
09:02 <+sburjan> cool :)  
09:02 <+sburjan> hope that will fix some issues  
09:02 <vmassol> why would it?  
09:02 <vmassol> what issues?  
09:02 <vmassol> it'll just allow to have faster feedback that's all  
09:03 <+sburjan> that's also an issue ;)  
09:03 <vmassol> yes  
09:04 <@cjdelisle> I'd rather we wait a few more days and have iptables rules  
09:04 <vmassol> I need to ping our admin about this. I'll forward your mail on the security list  
09:04 <vmassol> but I don't get it  
09:04 <vmassol> why waiting would make iptables set on the new machine?  
09:04 <afrey> has quit  
09:05 <vmassol> you need the machine first before setting them  
09:05 <afrey> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <vmassol> unless you want to test this first on the existing agetns, is that it?  
09:06 <@cjdelisle> What I'm saying is let's get the new one started on the right foot. As it is the state of 1 and 2 is a big ?  
09:06 <vmassol> creating the jira issue for our platform team  
09:07 <@cjdelisle> If you set your iptables on your home computer to log and drop anything that's not state RELATED,ESTABLISHED, you will be amazed how many times a day you get scanned.  
09:08 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: yes, that happens regularly :) one standard open port like 80 or 22 is enough :)  
09:14 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems xvnc is down again  
09:22 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/84/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/AllTests/org\_xwiki\_test\_ui\_AllTests/  
09:23 <+tmortagne> vmassol: other agent this time  
09:23 <vmassol> shoudn't we have a crontab to restart it automatically?  
09:23 <+tmortagne> restarting it  
09:23 <+tmortagne> probably  
09:23 <vmassol> could you do that or ask someone from infra to do it?  
09:24 <+tmortagne> don't have time today  
09:26 <vmassol> ok I've asked  
09:26 <vmassol> didn't take that long....  
09:26 <vmassol> :)  
09:26 <+tmortagne> did not say I did not have time to ask  
09:27 <vmassol> you did say that but anyway I'e done it  
09:27 <+tmortagne> just just answered to "could you do that"  
09:30 <vmassol> guys I'm excited by the possibility of fixing all flickers at once  
09:30 <vmassol> see my last mail on the list  
09:30 <vmassol> but I need some help from prototype-savvy and js-savvy committers  
09:45 <vmassol> cjdelisle: are you doing the final 3.1 release?  
09:45 <vmassol> btw guys 3.1 final is planned for next monday  
09:45 <vmassol> which means only in a few days  
09:45 <vmassol> we need to start preparing the release  
09:46 <vmassol> ie review if we have any blocer  
09:46 <vmassol> blocker  
09:47 <+sburjan> next week monday or in 2 weeks monday ?  
09:47 <vmassol> 13th  
09:47 <+sburjan> but this Monday is non-working :)  
09:47 <vmassol> only in france and only for some companies  
09:47 <vmassol> I don't know about the only in Frnace actually  
09:48 <+sburjan> I am free too  
09:48 <vmassol> but it doesn't change much  
09:48 <+sburjan> so I guess I'll have to start testing today :)  
09:48 <vmassol> if we don't do it Monday we can release tuesday  
09:48 <@cjdelisle> I was planning on releasing monday.  
09:48 <+sburjan> it does because I didn't know it was this Monday.. and I didn't started to test.  
09:49 <vmassol> cjdelisle: several of us won't be avail on Monday so might be better for you to do it on Tuesday so that you can get some help  
09:49 <vmassol> sburjan: it's been announced for 3 motnhs already  
09:49 <vmassol> it hasn't changed  
09:49 <@cjdelisle> Either works for me.  
09:49 <@cjdelisle> I do like help, esp. with the publicity end of it.  
09:50 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok maybe you could send a mail announcing that you intend to release Tuesday then and ask if anyone knows any blocker, etc?  
09:50 <+sburjan> yes but we didn't repsected all the release dates, and I thought everything will be moved  
09:50 <vmassol> sburjan: you have to trust the dates  
09:51 <vmassol> unless they're changed  
09:51 <vmassol> there was no mail changing this date  
09:51 <vmassol> nor any discussion  
09:51 <@cjdelisle> writing mail  
09:51 <+sburjan> ok. I will test today. stopping my other activities  
09:51 <vmassol> btw I just asked about blockers  
09:51 <vmassol> if we have blockers we might need to change the date a bit  
09:52 <vmassol> sburjan: do you know any blocker?  
09:52 <vmassol> (I mean as of now)  
09:52 <+sburjan> no blockers. but we have major issues .. at least regarding Oracle. But nothing Blocker  
09:53 <+sburjan> let's see if I find some today :)  
09:53 <vmassol> ok :)  
09:53 <vmassol> oracle shouldn't be a blocker for 3.1 IMO  
09:53 <vmassol> since we didn't introduce any regression for it  
09:53 <vmassol> but it could be for 3.2  
09:54 <vmassol> btw I need to send the proposal for the 3.2 roadmap  
09:54 <vmassol> doing it today  
09:54 <+sburjan> do you think it's too early to replace RTF with ODP export in 3.3 ?  
09:55 <+sburjan> we already have ODP explor. all we have is toremove the RTF and set ODP Export tu appear in the menu even when the Oo server is stopped  
09:56 <@cjdelisle> I wish we had a way to rename releases after they are done. This business of releasing again kind of breaks the consept of release candidate.  
09:58 <+sburjan> give codenames to releases ?  
09:58 <+sburjan> or wdym ?  
09:58 <@cjdelisle> do -rc-2 and then if it is good enough then just change the name.  
09:59 <@cjdelisle> That way the final is exactly the same as the accepted candidate, it's even from the same compiler cycle.  
09:59 <+sburjan> well depends how we decide. RC1 is for stabilization, but if almost nobody tests it it's released almost blindly like any other M2 or nightly build  
09:59 <@cjdelisle> err same compilation  
10:02 <vmassol> sburjan: 3.3?  
10:02 <+sburjan> vmassol: yes  
10:02 <vmassol> cjdelisle: we should be able to do this with build promotion using nexus  
10:03 <vmassol> (but I haven't investigated how it works and how it could work for our version.properties and metadata info in jar files)  
10:03 <vmassol> sburjan: 3.3 is not defined yet  
10:04 <vmassol> it could be done in 3.2 if we wanted  
10:04 <+sburjan> vmassol: I know.This is why I'm asking.Does this proposal to slip in 3.3 roadmap ?  
10:04 <vmassol> but we're defining 3.2 now  
10:04 <vmassol> not 3.3  
10:04 <+sburjan> I know. I was asking about the future :)  
10:04 <vmassol> who knows the future? I don't  
10:04 <+sburjan> we have enough for 3.2. This is why I asked for 3.3  
10:04 <vmassol> we're only defining one release ahead at this point  
10:05 <+sburjan> I know. But there were times when you were saying "we can do this in 2.x" .. meaning 1-2 versions in the future.  
10:06 <vmassol> not sure what you want me to say  
10:06 <vmassol> I can say: we could have in 3.3  
10:06 <vmassol> but that's not going to help much  
10:06 <vmassol> s/have/have it/  
10:06 <+sburjan> well I was just asking if youconsider fesable and doable in 3.3 :)  
10:06 <vmassol> of course  
10:07 <vmassol> as I said  
10:07 <vmassol> I even consider it feasible for 3.2  
10:07 <vmassol> :)  
10:07 <+sburjan> okay :)  
10:07 <vmassol> but I haven't proposed it on the roadmap  
10:07 <vmassol> which I've jsut sent  
10:07 <vmassol> but roadmap is a minimal roadmap  
10:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <+sburjan> I'll think if I'll propose it on the list for 3.2 or wait till 3.3  
10:08 <vmassol> cjdelisle: feel free to add stuff that you intedn to do on the roadmap mail  
10:08 <vmassol> like cassandra stuff  
10:10 <vmassol> bb in 20

10:45 <vmassol> that's because there's some admin work on agent2 going on  
10:45 <vmassol> to set up iptables  
10:54 <@cjdelisle> http://www.howtoforge.com/chrooted\_ssh\_howto\_debian  
11:20 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <abusenius> has quit  
11:40 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <vmassol> Enygma`: got problem building commons?  
11:41 <vmassol> I built it this morning and was ok for me  
11:41 <+Enygma`> hi, yes  
11:41 <+Enygma`> stable-3.0.x branch?  
11:41 <vmassol> ah no  
11:41 <vmassol> I built master  
11:41 <+Enygma`> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.6:check (default) on project xwiki-commons-core: Execution default of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.6:check failed: Plugin org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.6 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Failure to find org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-verification-resources:jar:1.17-SNAPSHOT in http://maven.xwiki.or  
11:42 <+Enygma`> checkstyle deppends on commons-verification-resources:jar:1.17-SNAPSHOT  
11:42 <vmassol> I think that's because  
11:42 <vmassol> we remove old snapshots  
11:42 <+mflorea> Enygma`: looks like stable-3.0.x was badly merged from svn https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/tree/stable-3.0.x  
11:42 <vmassol> on the remote repo  
11:42 <+Enygma`> I see  
11:42 <+tmortagne> 3.0 should not depends on snapshots  
11:42 <+mflorea> it has only commons-core  
11:43 <+tmortagne> (I mean plugin/application snapshots)  
11:44 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: do you know why https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/tree/stable-3.0.x has only commons-core?  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> No  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> Checking  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> Hm, I think I combined the three repos (commons-pom, commons-tools, commons-core) only on master  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> Since 3.0 was supposed to be stable  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> So no more updates to pom or tools were needed  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> Two solutions:  
11:47 <+mflorea> I see, then we can fix the versions  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> 1. Change the SNAPSHOT dependencies to the stable version  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> Since bugfix versions are supposed to depend on the same versions  
11:48 <@sdumitriu> And only merge in the modules that do need to be updated  
11:48 <vmassol> sdumitriu: do you know why Event.observers is undefined. shouldn't it list all observers? Maybe it's the version of prototype we're using that doesn't have it?  
11:48 <@sdumitriu> (this is what we did on platform 3.0.x as well, where we merged only solibri, web and administration)  
11:49 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I'll change the poms  
11:49 <@sdumitriu> 2. Re-organize stable-3.0.x to have the same structure as master, with all 3 projects as top-level directories  
11:50 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: First time I see Event.observers  
11:50 <@sdumitriu> Where did you find it?  
11:50 <vmassol> in several docs  
11:50 <vmassol> google "Event.observers"  
11:52 <@sdumitriu> "NOTE: This article uses Prototype 1.5.0\_pre0"  
11:53 <vmassol> this looks cool: http://www.programmish.com/?p=33  
11:53 <vmassol> they talk avout Event.cache  
11:54 <@sdumitriu> I think it's custom code  
11:54 <@sdumitriu> Not something standard  
11:59 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Is there an open issue for the import problem with WysiwygConfig?  
12:00 <@sdumitriu> (btw, I'm almost done with a fix for it)  
12:00 <+mflorea> no  
12:00 <@sdumitriu> OK, I'll create one  
12:06 <+mflorea> Enygma`: can you pull and try again?  
12:33 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <+Enygma`> BUILD SUCCESS  
12:59 <+Enygma`>  thanks mflorea  
13:36 <jvdrean> has quit  
13:38 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <vmassol> converting Backlinks test to sel2  
13:52 <+sburjan> +1  
13:52 <jvelociter\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:52 <jvelociter> has quit  
13:52 <jvelociter\_> is now known as <jvelociter>  
13:55 <+tmortagne> looking at WatchListTest  
14:00 <vmassol> one important test migrate is UsersGroupsRightsManagementTest since it's flickering in sel1  
14:01 <vmassol> but it's a big one...  
14:01 <vmassol> we should move it bit by bit probably  
14:28 <jvelociter> has quit  
14:52 <+sburjan> vmassol: I'm not finding any blocker  
14:52 <vmassol> good  
14:52 <+sburjan> I guess this is good, but I'm afraid the MTR will be empty  
14:52 <vmassol> even better  
14:52 <vmassol> why empty?  
14:52 <vmassol> you mean all green and not red?  
14:52 <+sburjan> because I didn't find anything new so far which hasn't been reported  
14:52 <+sburjan> yes ...  
14:52 <vmassol> good for us  
14:52 <vmassol> and bad for you  
14:52 <vmassol> :)  
14:53 <+sburjan> yes :)  
14:53 <+sburjan> I can't always win :P  
14:53 <vmassol> be creative I'm sure you can find stuff  
14:53 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: One more thing to test is upgrading from the previous version  
14:53 <vmassol> btw did you test the extension manager  
14:54 <vmassol> ?  
14:54 <@sdumitriu> You should include that in the MTR  
14:54 <+sburjan> vmassol: nope, I didn't tested EM  
14:54 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I tested on standard jetty-hsqldb package  
14:54 <vmassol> tmortagne: is it interesting that sorin starts testing it in 3.1?  
14:55 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you mean 3.2 ?  
14:55 <+sburjan> I've seen on the dev list that JV will work on a better UI  
14:55 <vmassol> I meant 3.1  
14:55 <vmassol> I'm not concerned by ui  
14:55 <vmassol> to test the backend impl  
14:56 <vmassol> (through the simple ui)  
14:56 <+tmortagne> not sure what this has to do with extension manager  
14:56 <vmassol> in other words is it supposed to work  
14:56 <+tmortagne> xar meerging is 3.2  
14:56 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: To test an upgrade, replace the database directory with the one from the previous version  
14:56 <vmassol> yes but 3.1 has already features for EM  
14:56 <vmassol> last time I tested it it wasn't working for ex  
14:56 <vmassol> even though it was already supposed to ork  
14:56 <vmassol> work  
14:57 <+tmortagne> sure but I don't understand, didn't sburjan already test 3.1 since that's what we are releasing ?  
14:57 <vmassol> he did  
14:57 <vmassol> but he hasn(t included EM  
14:57 <vmassol> in his tests apparently  
14:57 <+tmortagne> sburjan already tested several time EM in the past  
14:57 <vmassol> hence my questions to both of you  
14:57 <+tmortagne> so it's not something new for me  
14:57 <vmassol> sburjan: then why is it not part of the MTR?  
14:57 <vmassol> we should add it  
14:58 <+sburjan> because it is listed as experimental  
14:58 <vmassol> yes but we want to make it not experimental  
14:58 <vmassol> :)  
14:58 <+sburjan> and I didn't knew I had to test experimental stuff  
14:58 <+tmortagne> experimental does not mean not supposed to work, just that APIs are not stable and that UI did not yet reached 1.0 version  
14:58 <vmassol> and this means testing it  
14:58 <vmassol> :)  
14:58 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <+tmortagne> not experimental=you can use it in production without any fear  
15:00 <jvelociter\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <jvelociter> has quit  
15:00 <jvelociter\_> is now known as <jvelociter>  
15:00 <vmassol> sburjan: we're getting closer to EM being ready  
15:00 <vmassol> so it's a good thing to test it at each release IMO  
15:00 <vmassol> if you could add it it would be great  
15:00 <+sburjan> ok. I will add it to the MTR  
15:00 <vmassol> thanks  
15:01 <+tmortagne> it mostly depends how far we will be able to go with the UI but could be not experimental anymore starting with 3.3 I guess (could be ready for 3.2 maybe but a bit too young)  
15:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: personally I expect lots of issues with it before it's stable enough. I'd love to be wrong though  
15:03 <vmassol> (not talking about UI)  
15:03 <vmassol> I'll give it a shot on master later on  
15:03 <+tmortagne> vmassol: sue that's whay i'm talking about 3.3 branch as heasy test and stabilization  
15:04 <+evalica> the EM should be tested especially on Windows - because I was not able to get it running (when I was doing my mockups)  
15:05 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <+tmortagne> evalica: you should report error when you have one since it's supposed to work on windows, if it's not recent it's probably because of the : which is fixed now  
15:08 <vmassol> ok stopping agents  
15:08 <vmassol> they're both stuck it seems  
15:08 <vmassol> oh there's agent3 :)  
15:09 <vmassol> alex is setting it up  
15:24 <+sburjan> I have enabled Multilingual and setthe default language to ro. beu when going to Main.WebHome, I still get english version. not content nor upper icons are set to ro  
15:24 <+sburjan> this seems a bug  
15:25 <+sburjan> can someone confirm ?  
15:26 <vmassol> looks ok  
15:26 <vmassol> what would you have expected?  
15:26 <vmassol> (sburjan)  
15:28 <+sburjan> so when multilingual is enabled the default language is not taken into account.

16:18 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> Q: What should I do when changing class properties and migrating the old properties can't be done without loss of data?  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> For example, changing a Number property from long to int, and one of the existing long properties doesn't fit in an int field  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> Or when changing from Textarea to String (LargeString -> String), and existing properties are longer than 255  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> Options:  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> 1. Drop the old data, replace with empty  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> 2. Leave the old properties in place, they will show up as deprecated properties and might cause ghosts if the document is saved again without manually removing the old properties  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> 3. Try to trim the old data to fit in the new property, losing some stuff  
16:20 <@sdumitriu> I'd go for 1, since this is not something that should happen often  
16:20 <@sdumitriu> Usually we go the other way around, from smaller to larger fields  
16:22 <+tmortagne> should probably be a mail, I have the same questions myself in the context of xar merging  
16:22 <vmassol> you definitely need to log it for sure at the very least so that the admin knows  
16:23 <vmassol> yes should be a mail I think too, it's important  
16:23 <vmassol> 4. Report the issue to the admin and let him approve each change ;)  
16:23 <vmassol> (4 is what we should do)  
16:24 <+tmortagne> vmassol: 4 is what is planned on the fly for xar merging ;)  
16:24 <+tmortagne> but that require some work so in the meantime for the non interactive mode...  
16:24 <vmassol> for non interactive mode  
16:24 <vmassol> the user should should the option when running it  
16:25 <+tmortagne> you don't always want to resolve conflict the same way for everything  
16:25 <vmassol> s/should/choose/  
16:25 <vmassol> what I mean is that he needs to understan what he's doing  
16:25 <vmassol>  + get some logs reporting what happened  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> The easiest thing to do is 2, it's what happens at the moment anyway  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> And since it's not a regression, I might just leave it like that  
16:26 <@sdumitriu> Easier for me  
16:26 <@sdumitriu> If tmortagne finds a nice way to report, then we'll integrate that in the future  
16:26 <@cjdelisle> This would be a non-issue if we declared that the only 2 ways to alter a property are to add one or to remove one.  
16:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu: at least make sure you generate logs for issues  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> K  
16:27 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: work for the wiki but not when upgrading a xar  
16:28 <@cjdelisle> Well you would have to understand when the xar developer is modifying things what the effect is going to be.  
16:28 <@cjdelisle> s/you/the xar developer/

16:29 <vmassol> cjdelisle: yes the plan is to display a warning when the user modifies an app page  
16:29 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: well that's what we are talking about: what do we do when a property type changed

17:55 <+tmortagne> "http://" + domain + ":" + port
